projects.title: Determination of the Oxidation States of the Cerium Oxide Thin Films using X-ray Photo-electron Spectroscopy (XPS)
projects.description: Project performed in the group High Temperature Sensory and the group Physics of Surfaces and Interfaces; investigated cerium oxidation states associated with phase transitions as a function of temperature and oxygen partial pressure; prepared sample, designed vacuum system, operated XPS measurement, processed XPS data and interpreted results

contributors.headline: System Industrialization Architect and Coach for ASML Technical Talent Program

projects.title: Impedance Spectroscopy on Langasite Resonator with Cerium Oxide Layer
projects.description: Project performed in the group High Temperature Sensory; fabricated piezoelectric Langasite resonator (sensitive to mass change) with specific resonance frequency measured by impedance spectroscopy; deposited cerium oxide thin layer (different oxidation states sensitive to the gas pressure) using pulsed-laser-deposition (PLD); compared different electrode fabrications using optical lithography, screen printing and physical vapour deposition

contributors.headline: System Industrialization Architect and Coach for ASML Technical Talent Program

projects.title: Vibrometer Measurement on Piezoelectric Materials with Different Types of Resonance
projects.description: Project performed in the group High Temperature Sensory; performed FEM analysis (ANSYS) and experimental investigation using Laser Doppler Vibrometer on the vibration models of piezoelectric tuning forks and plates

contributors.headline: System Industrialization Architect and Coach for ASML Technical Talent Program

projects.title: Sol-Gel Growth of Ultra-Thin Vanadium Oxide Layer on Si(001) & Its Characterization using AFM and AES
projects.description: Project performed in the group Physics of Surfaces and Interfaces; using AFM and AES to characterize the Vanadium oxide layer (~ nm) prepared by Sol-Gel approach as a fucntion of Sol-Gel concentration and annealing temperature

courses.name: General, Inorganical, Analytical & Solid State Chemistry

profile_positions.description:
As a technical lead from an industrialization point of view, I contribute to the development of EUV source - High Power Drive Laser (major focus on racks, cabinets, PCBA) by specifying, integrating and verifying the industrialization requirements for its electrical/mechanical/machine conditioning layout related functions, and improve proposed designs and processes from the early design phase until the use of the system at customer fabs. My major responsibilities include:

• Translate the overall function design into an architecture that meets these requirements of cycle time, availability and cost of goods, create and balance the budget towards the different users in the function
• Analyze and explain gaps between expected and actual performance and give direction for solutions. Maintain a lessons learned database for future design and process improvements. Document and present the current status and predicted results to projects and the wider organization. 
• Create and maintain technical product documentation (e.g. EPS, EDS, pFMEA, ADR, Sequence overview, TPS) on industrialization requirements and deliverables. Oversee implementation of industrialization requirements and budgets in the conceptual and detail designs. Verify and validate the system performance based on cycle time measurements during system integration and field feedbacks.
profile_positions.title: System Industrialization Architect (High Power Drive Laser Layout)

profile_positions.description:
•	Contribute to High Power Seed Laser Controls, Diagnostic & Application Roadmap
•	Define new diagnostic capability incl. SW obserables together with our drive laser supplier
•	Improve and implement high power seed laser diagnostic functionality in ASML software platform
•	System fleet Performance
profile_positions.title: Diagnostic Architect for EUV Source High Power Seed Module (focus on Control & Software)

profile_positions.description:
•	Define diagnostic roadmap and solutions to reduce availability loss of high power seed laser module for EUV source
•	Design the failure mode matrix and deterministic diagnostic flow with diagnostic specifications for part failures and performance degradation together with suppliers
•	Define functional KPIs and context filters and deploy them in ASML SW platform 
•	Advanced data analytics (data architecture, visualization dashboard,  smart algorithms etc.)
profile_positions.title: Diagnostic Architect for EUV Source High Power Seed Module (focus on Hardware)

profile_positions.description:
•	Specialize in EUV source system performance & integration, customer escalations, failure root cause finding using machine learning algorithms
•	EUV source plasma modelling
•	Multi Lot Endurance Test/Marathon run (incl. parameters of plasma recipe, image layer, dose margin etc.)
•	Dose performance report (KPIs: die yield, dose error, throughput)
•	Multi-variate regression tool for trouble shooting long term power degradation 
•	145 W EUV source new product introduction to Taiwan customers
profile_positions.title: Plasma and Laser Physics Engineer/Design Engineer in EUV Source Performance and Integration group

profile_positions.location: Resources & Recycling, TU Delft, the Netherlands
profile_positions.description: In EU Horizon 2020 project HISER, correlate sensor data with the quality of the final products composed of recycled materials using advanced regression statistics (e.g. PLS, Adaboost, lasso and support vector machine) and physical modelling (e.g. plasma emission and particle packing).
profile_positions.title: Researcher
PhD researcher in laser-induced plasma spectroscopy

company.name: Laser Application Centre, Energy Research Centre of Lower Saxony, Germany

profile_positions.company: Laser Application Centre, Energy Research Centre of Lower Saxony, Germany
profile_positions.description: Fabricated piezoelectric components, measured and modeled (FEM analysis) their resonance modes using laser Doppler vibrometry & impedance spectroscopy; prepared thin rare earth element layers that are sensitive to gas partial pressure using Sol-Gel, Pulsed Laser Deposition; prepared Pt/Au electrodes using screen printing, UV optical lithography and physical/chemical vapor depositions; designed setups (e.g. PID pumping controller, Al2O3 tubes) for high vacuum and high temperature conditions.

volunteer_experiences.role: Coach for ASML Technical Talent Program (TTP)
volunteer_experiences.description:
•	As TTP project team member, contribute to the improvement of the overall quality of TTP, e.g. update the program curriculum content acc. ASML business drivers, and participate in the recruitment process of TTP candidates
•	Support and help TTP group coordinators to be well prepared for TTP modules for their TTP groups
